t: Job 40
Moreover*p the Lord*s answered Job, and said:
“Shall*pn the one who contends with the Almighty correct Him?*i He*ld who rebukes God, let him answer it.”
Job’s Response to God
Then*p Job answered the Lord*s and said:
“Behold,*pn I am vile; What*ld shall I answer You? I*ld lay my hand over my mouth.
Once*ld I have spoken, but I will not answer; Yes,*ld twice, but I will proceed no further.”
God’s Challenge to Job
Then*p the Lord*s answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:
“Now*pn prepare yourself like a man; I*ld will question you, and you shall answer Me:
“Would*ln you indeed annul My judgment? Would*ld you condemn Me that you may be justified?
Have*ld you an arm like God? Or*ld can you thunder with a voice like His?
Then*ld adorn yourself with*i majesty and splendor, And*ld array yourself with glory and beauty.
Disperse*ld the rage of your wrath; Look*ld on everyone who*i is*i proud, and humble him.
Look*ld on everyone who*i is*i proud, and*i bring him low; Tread*ld down the wicked in their place.
Hide*ld them in the dust together, Bind*ld their faces in hidden darkness.*i
Then*ld I will also confess to you That*ld your own right hand can save you.
“Look*ln now at the behemoth, which I made along*i with you; He*ld eats grass like an ox.
See*ld now, his strength is*i in his hips, And*ld his power is*i in his stomach muscles.
He*ld moves his tail like a cedar; The*ld sinews of his thighs are tightly knit.
His*ld bones are*i like*i beams of bronze, His*ld ribs like bars of iron.
He*ld is*i the first of the ways of God; Only*ld He who made him can bring near His sword.
Surely*ld the mountains yield food for him, And*ld all the beasts of the field play there.
He*ld lies under the lotus trees, In*ld a covert of reeds and marsh.
The*ld lotus trees cover him with*i their shade; The*ld willows by the brook surround him.
Indeed*ld the river may rage, Yet*ild he is not disturbed; He*ld is confident, though the Jordan gushes into his mouth,
Though*ild he takes it in his eyes, Or*ild one pierces his*i nose with a snare.
